definition:
There are different definitions of [*semifield*]{}. We give three such
which are not .

Let $K$ be a set with two binary operations “$+$” and “$\cdot$”.

-   Semifield $(K,\,+,\,\cdot)$ is a semiring where all non-zero
    elements have a multiplicative inverse.

-   Semifield is the algebraic system $(K,\,+,\,\cdot)$, where $(K,\,+)$
    is a group (identity $:= 0$), the multiplication “$\cdot$”
    distributes over the addition “$+$”, $K$ the multiplicative identity
    $:= 1$ and all equations $ax = b$ and $ya = b$ with $a \ne 0$ have
    solutions $x$, $y$ in $K$.

-   Semifield $(K,\,+,\,\cdot)$ satisfies all postulates of field except
    the associativity of the multiplication “$\cdot$”.
